meanings.definition: To endure or suffer through something difficult or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: She had to dree the long wait at the doctor's office.
meanings.sent2: I had to dree the storm until it passed.
meanings.sent3: He decided to dree the boring lecture by doodling in his notebook.
meanings.sent4: The old tree seemed to dree the harsh winter winds with grace.
meanings.sent5: The brave knight had to dree the dragon's fiery breath to save the princess.

meanings.sent1: Don't dree any longer; we need to leave now.
meanings.sent2: The train dreed at the station, causing delays.
meanings.sent3: The cat liked to dree around the house before finally settling down.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to dree as they waited for the test results.
meanings.sent5: The decision to dree the meeting led to frustration among the team members.

meanings.definition: To make something last longer than necessary.
meanings.sent1: She always drees her chores to avoid doing homework.
meanings.sent2: The chef dreed the cooking process to enhance the flavors.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to dree the presentation by adding unnecessary details.
meanings.sent4: The magician dreed the magic show to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent5: The artist decided to dree the painting to add more depth to the artwork.
